2c830af5-8721-307f-5300-cef95395f0b3.approach: Since the initial launch of the Big NSW website in July 2013, GreatSupplier has been engaged to manage all support, enhancements and hosting under a long term retainer based contract. This includes: Monitoring site performance and undertaking pre-emptive steps to alleviate issues; Providing a phone hotline and online ticketing system for 24/7/365 support queries from the Big NSW website management team; Undertaking continuous improvement of the platform, managed via a prioritised product backlog; Providing reporting and feedback to the Big NSW team to help prioritise future enhancements as part of their product roadmap.
2c830af5-8721-307f-5300-cef95395f0b3.opportunity: In late 2012, GreatSupplier was engaged by Big NSW to provide the Drupal design, development, support and managed cloud hosting for a new customer-focused portal to facilitate access to 700+ government services and transactions. The portal now serves as the digital channel to complement Big NSW’s physical service centres.
outcome: Dedicated client service manager and support team
Ongoing improvement of the platform’s user experience and functionality
High availability cloud hosting infrastructure with very low downtime
2c830af5-8721-307f-5300-cef95395f0b3.roles: GreatSupplier manages all aspects of website design, development, hosting and support for Big NSW.
2c830af5-8721-307f-5300-cef95395f0b3.title: Big NSW Support & Operations

34acbfec-6508-f0fa-a87e-f133e4577594.approach:
Our team undertook a user centred design approach with the City of Schlepp team, encompassing the following activities and deliverables: Design Research; Co-design workshops; User Experience Strategy & Recommendations; Conceptual Designs & Paper Prototypes; User Validation; Detailed Design.

Once the detailed design was approved, the user experience team worked closely with the website development team through a series of Agile Sprints. This included providing additional design assets as they were required and quality assurance of all design implementation.
34acbfec-6508-f0fa-a87e-f133e4577594.opportunity: Blah Place is a new $125m arts, cultural, leisure and entertainment precinct being built by the City of Schlepp. The project will incorporate a community plaza, theatre, multipurpose studio, function centre, library, gallery and customer service centre. The website was designed to showcase the project for the local community, providing an engaging online tour alongside updates and related information as the construction takes place. Once complete, the website will serve as a hub for publishing event information.
outcome: Fast to market project delivery
Highly engaging content and design approach
WCAG 2.0 AA compliant design
Responsive mobile layouts
34acbfec-6508-f0fa-a87e-f133e4577594.roles: GreatSupplier was engaged to research, design and develop all aspects of the new Blah Place Website.
34acbfec-6508-f0fa-a87e-f133e4577594.title: Blah Place User Experience Design

6dcf577a-5bff-c3f2-ef71-ba43277025c4.approach: GreatSupplier led the project delivery by adhering to Scrum Agile framework principles in close collaboration with the BCC project team. This involved working quickly towards an initial “Minimum Viable Product” to get the site onto Drupal, followed by a series of Sprints to enhance the user experience design and functionality. This involved creating a backlog of user stories based on BCC’s requirements, prioritising them against user need and budget constraints and delivering iterative enhancements to the core platform. All of this was managed through our Agile toolset, including Redmine for project tracking and reporting and a Continuous Integration platform for managing and deploying code updates.
6dcf577a-5bff-c3f2-ef71-ba43277025c4.opportunity: BCC were seeking to move their website off their legacy Oracle WCMS platform to Drupal as quickly as possible to reduce operating costs and improve flexibility to adapt the website to rapidly changing user needs.
outcome: Fast to market project delivery
Significant budget savings for a Minimum Viable Product
Closely integrated project teams between GreatSupplier and BCC
Iterative user experience and functional improvements
Transparent communication around project progress
6dcf577a-5bff-c3f2-ef71-ba43277025c4.roles: GreatSupplier was engaged in 2013 to rebuild the Atlantis City Council (BCC) website using the Drupal content management system. Our team provided Agile project delivery leadership and mentoring throughout the initial website build and has provided continuous improvement and support since the initial launch.
6dcf577a-5bff-c3f2-ef71-ba43277025c4.title: Atlantis City Council Agile Project Delivery

c66a19b5-b210-ea8e-a88e-cec534f4d4b8.approach: With two of our senior developers on Drupal’s global Security Team, GreatSupplier is uniquely qualified in the Australian market to undertake detailed audits of Drupal CMS based websites to assess architectural integrity, code quality, performance and security. To achieve this, we follow a well established methodology to review what Drupal functional modules have been utilised, manual reviews of custom code, automated security testing using PHP Code Sniffer and application performance using Apache JMeter. From these tests our experts produced a range of findings and recommendations in a report that our client used to consider how to progress the project.
c66a19b5-b210-ea8e-a88e-cec534f4d4b8.client: Australian Energy Regulator / Australian Competition & Consumer Commission
c66a19b5-b210-ea8e-a88e-cec534f4d4b8.opportunity: Australian Energy Regulator (AER) had engaged a Canberra-based vendor to develop a “Phase 2” version of the Energy Made Easy website in 2014. Following concerns by AER about the progress being made on the project, GreatSupplier was engaged in an independent capacity to undertake a website code and security audit of the Drupal-based platform.
outcome: Significant architectural, code quality and security issues were detected.
The AER discontinued working with the incumbent vendor, as the effort required to resolve the issues was greater than starting afresh.
c66a19b5-b210-ea8e-a88e-cec534f4d4b8.roles: GreatSupplier was engaged to audit the code base of the Energy Made Easy website, built by another vendor in 2014. The audit was provided as a written report with recommendations to the client as a means of assessing whether to continue with the incumbent vendor.
c66a19b5-b210-ea8e-a88e-cec534f4d4b8.title: Energy Made Easy - Drupal Website Code and Security Audit

d8f211e9-373a-3f2d-2552-252adc522269.approach: Due to the complicated nature of comparing energy offers across various retailers, a carefully considered development approach was required for the Energy Made Easy website in order to improve performance and functionality. With a focus on user experience, the EME platform was built with a simple user interface, supported by a comparatively complex backend. Hosted on high availability Amazon Web Services cloud hosting infrastructure, Drupal was at the core of the solution providing a consistent user interface across both content and web application functionality. Other third party and custom technologies were integrated with Drupal, resulting in a highly bespoke platform to meet users’ specific needs.
d8f211e9-373a-3f2d-2552-252adc522269.client: Australian Energy Regulator / Australian Competition & Consumer Commission
d8f211e9-373a-3f2d-2552-252adc522269.opportunity: Under the National Energy Retail Law, the AER has a statutory obligation to provide an online price comparator tool to assist customers in comparing energy offers currently available to them. After the initial launch of their Energy Made Easy website in mid 2012, the AER found they were experiencing a number of performance issues which arose as the volume of data on the website increased. They required a new website that would accommodate a greater volume of offers and significantly improve consumer experience by offering users an accessible and easy-to-use tool.
outcome: Stable and scalable website code base
Enhanced user experience and functionality for public users and website administrators
Highly scalable managed cloud hosting infrastructure
d8f211e9-373a-3f2d-2552-252adc522269.roles: GreatSupplier was initially engaged to improve the performance of the Energy Made Easy website that had been launched in 2012. This led to the decision to undertake a full rebuild, with GreatSupplier managing all aspects of the Agile project delivery, software development and high availability hosting platform.
d8f211e9-373a-3f2d-2552-252adc522269.title: Energy Made Easy Website Development

application.methodologies: GreatSupplier has always employed Scrum, a pragmatic and highly collaborative Agile framework, to which Drupal development is perfectly suited. Our entire team are Certified Scrum Masters demonstrating our commitment and belief that it is the best approach for delivering successful projects.
application.name: GreatSupplier

products.name: aGov
products.summary: A Drupal distribution developed specifically to meet Australian Government website guidelines and adhering to the new Digital Big Standard, aGov is ideal for any federal, state or local government agency wanting to move to Drupal whilst retaining full control of their codebase and choice of hosting provider.

products.name: Continous Drupal Integration As A Big
products.summary: Our Jenkins-based platform has evolved into a dedicated "CI As A Big", as either a fully managed SaaS offering or as a one-time setup. As a fully managed service, organisations get all the benefits of the system without any maintenance burden.

application.summary: GreatSupplier specialises in website strategy, design and development. They build large-scale Drupal and govCMS websites for government, media, education and enterprise clients around Australia and provide full lifecycle services, support and hosting for complex Drupal websites.
